criterion: Provides a clear and accurate definition of out-of-network coverage
Explains the billing process for out-of-network services
Describes the potential costs and responsibilities for out-of-network services
Incorrectly states that out-of-network services are always more expensive
Does not address the potential for separate deductibles for out-of-network services
Uses technical jargon without explaining it
Asks the user what they would like to know about out-of-network coverage
Incorrectly states that insurance plans always track in-network and out-of-network spending under a single deductible
Provides a clear and concise explanation of the difference between in-network and out-of-network coverage
Fails to mention the potential for higher costs for out-of-network services
Does not provide an example of a scenario where out-of-network coverage might be necessary
